SortPom Plugin
Last Published: 2015-07-18  | Version: 2.4.1-SNAPSHOT
SortPom Plugin
Parent Project
  • SortPom
Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

sortpom:verify

Full name:

com.github.ekryd.sortpom:sortpom-maven-plugin:2.4.1-SNAPSHOT:verify

Description:

Verifies that the pom.xml is sorted. If the verification fails then the pom.xml is sorted.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • The goal is thread-safe and supports parallel builds.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
backupFileExtension String - Name of the file extension for the backup file.
Default value is: .bak.
User property is: sort.backupFileExtension.
createBackupFile boolean - Should a backup copy be created for the sorted pom.
Default value is: true.
User property is: sort.createBackupFile.
encoding String - Encoding for the files.
Default value is: UTF-8.
User property is: sort.encoding.
expandEmptyElements boolean - Should empty xml elements be expanded or not. Example: <configuration></configuration> or <configuration/>
Default value is: true.
User property is: sort.expandEmptyElements.
indentBlankLines boolean - Should blank lines (if preserved) have indentation.
Default value is: false.
User property is: sort.indentBlankLines.
keepBlankLines boolean - Should blank lines in the pom-file be preserved. A maximum of one line is preserved between each tag.
Default value is: false.
User property is: sort.keepBlankLines.
lineSeparator String - Line separator for sorted pom. Can be either \n, \r or \r\n
Default value is: ${line.separator}.
User property is: sort.lineSeparator.
nrOfIndentSpace int - Number of space characters to use as indentation. A value of -1 indicates that tab character should be used instead.
Default value is: 2.
User property is: sort.nrOfIndentSpace.
pomFile File - This is the File instance that refers to the location of the pom that should be sorted.
Default value is: ${project.file}.
User property is: sort.pomFile.
predefinedSortOrder String - Choose between a number of predefined sort order files.
User property is: sort.predefinedSortOrder.
skip boolean - Set this to 'true' to bypass sortpom plugin
Default value is: false.
User property is: sort.skip.
sortDependencies String - Comma-separated ordered list how dependencies should be sorted. Example: scope,groupId,artifactId If scope is specified in the list then the scope ranking is COMPILE, PROVIDED, SYSTEM, RUNTIME, IMPORT and TEST. The list can be separated by ",;:"
User property is: sort.sortDependencies.
sortOrderFile String - Custom sort order file.
User property is: sort.sortOrderFile.
sortPlugins String - Comma-separated ordered list how plugins should be sorted. Example: groupId,artifactId The list can be separated by ",;:"
User property is: sort.sortPlugins.
sortProperties boolean - Should the Maven pom properties be sorted alphabetically. Affects both project/properties and project/profiles/profile/properties
Default value is: false.
User property is: sort.sortProperties.
verifyFail String - What should happen if verification fails. Can be either 'sort', 'warn' or 'stop'
Default value is: sort.
User property is: sort.verifyFail.

Parameter Details

backupFileExtension:

Name of the file extension for the backup file.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.backupFileExtension
  • Default: .bak

createBackupFile:

Should a backup copy be created for the sorted pom.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.createBackupFile
  • Default: true

encoding:

Encoding for the files.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.encoding
  • Default: UTF-8

expandEmptyElements:

Should empty xml elements be expanded or not. Example: <configuration></configuration> or <configuration/>
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.expandEmptyElements
  • Default: true

indentBlankLines:

Should blank lines (if preserved) have indentation.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.indentBlankLines
  • Default: false

keepBlankLines:

Should blank lines in the pom-file be preserved. A maximum of one line is preserved between each tag.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.keepBlankLines
  • Default: false

lineSeparator:

Line separator for sorted pom. Can be either \n, \r or \r\n
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.lineSeparator
  • Default: ${line.separator}

nrOfIndentSpace:

Number of space characters to use as indentation. A value of -1 indicates that tab character should be used instead.
  • Type: int
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.nrOfIndentSpace
  • Default: 2

pomFile:

This is the File instance that refers to the location of the pom that should be sorted.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.pomFile
  • Default: ${project.file}

predefinedSortOrder:

Choose between a number of predefined sort order files.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.predefinedSortOrder

skip:

Set this to 'true' to bypass sortpom plugin
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.skip
  • Default: false

sortDependencies:

Comma-separated ordered list how dependencies should be sorted. Example: scope,groupId,artifactId If scope is specified in the list then the scope ranking is COMPILE, PROVIDED, SYSTEM, RUNTIME, IMPORT and TEST. The list can be separated by ",;:"
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.sortDependencies

sortOrderFile:

Custom sort order file.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.sortOrderFile

sortPlugins:

Comma-separated ordered list how plugins should be sorted. Example: groupId,artifactId The list can be separated by ",;:"
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.sortPlugins

sortProperties:

Should the Maven pom properties be sorted alphabetically. Affects both project/properties and project/profiles/profile/properties
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.sortProperties
  • Default: false

verifyFail:

What should happen if verification fails. Can be either 'sort', 'warn' or 'stop'
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: sort.verifyFail
  • Default: sort
